p: The biomass of neighbouring communities and C. stoebe in the absence/presence of competition was analysed using Tukey’s Honest Significant Difference (HSD) post-hoc comparison after one-way/two-way Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) with neighbouring community origin or/and geo-cytotypes of C. stoebe as fixed factors. We assessed the impact of three geo-cytotypes of C. stoebe in the competition containers as the comparison among aboveground biomass of neighbouring communities. For the proportion of flowering C. stoebe plants, a Generalized Linear Models (GLM) with quasi-Poisson error (due to over-dispersion, the dispersion parameter was more than 1.59 [ 39, 40]) was used, then ANOVA analyses were accomplished by comparing the model fits with model deleted independent variables in which we specified test = “F”. Multiple comparisons among factors were done using a t-test based on the best model and pairwise comparisons within the factor were done using Tukey Contrasts. We thus assessed the early relative reproductive capacity of three geo-cytotypes of C. stoebe in the competition containers as the comparison among the proportion flowering of C. stoebe.
